analyzed: spyan gsum pa /
translated: He has three eyes.

original: ral pa'i thor tshugs can /
analyzed: ral pa'i thor tshugs can /
translated: He has matted hair.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: He has the nature of pure conduct.

original: phyag g-yas pa rnams na phyag 'tshal ba dang / phreng ba dang / bum pa dang / mchog sbyin du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa rnams na phyag 'tshal ba dang / phreng ba dang / bum pa dang / mchog sbyin du mdzad pa'o //
translated: His right hands are in the gesture of homage, hold a rosary, hold a vase, and give the boon of fearlessness.

original: g-yon rnams ni po ti dang / dbyu gu gsum pa dang / bum pa spyi blugs dang / mnyam gzhag go //🔽zhabs padma'i skyil krung du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yon rnams ni po ti dang / dbyu gu gsum pa dang / bum pa spyi blugs dang / mnyam gzhag go // zhabs padma'i skyil krung du bzhugs pa /
translated: The left hands hold a scripture, a three-pointed khaṭvāṅga staff, a water jar, and are in the gesture of meditative equipoise.🔽He sits in the lotus posture.

original: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He sits on a lotus seat.

original: tadya th'a zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tadya th'a zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Tadyathā means “thus.”

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas smras shing rjes su yi rang ba'i rig sngags kyi gsang sngags blta ba'o //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas smras shing rjes su yi rang ba'i rig sngags kyi gsang sngags blta ba'o //
translated: The secret mantra of the vidyā is spoken by Brahmā, lord of the Sahā world, and is to be recited with delight.

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags ni hi li hi li mi li la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags ni hi li hi li mi li la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret mantra of the vidyā is hili mili and so forth.

original: dug bcom mo dug nges par bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dug bcom mo dug nges par bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Poison is destroyed, poison is definitely destroyed” means

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis nang gi dug gsum dang / phyi'i dug gsum bcom mo //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis nang gi dug gsum dang / phyi'i dug gsum bcom mo //
translated: that the three inner poisons and the three outer poisons are destroyed by the splendor of the secret mantra of the vidyā.

original: nang gi dug gsum ni gti mug zhe sdang 'dod chags so //
analyzed: nang gi dug gsum ni gti mug zhe sdang 'dod chags so //
translated: The three inner poisons are delusion, hatred, and desire.

original: phyi'i dug gsum ni bsdad pa dang 'gro ba dang / byas pa'i dug go //
analyzed: phyi'i dug gsum ni bsdad pa dang 'gro ba dang / byas pa'i dug go //
translated: The three outer poisons are the poison of staying, the poison of going, and the poison of what is done.

original: gti mug ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis shes pa bkag nas ye shes mi 'char ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug ni glo bur gyi rkyen gyis shes pa bkag nas ye shes mi 'char ba ste /
translated: Delusion is the non-arising of pristine consciousness by the consciousness being blocked by the condition of the sudden.

original: des gti mug yin no //
analyzed: des gti mug yin no //
translated: That is delusion.

original: de nye bar gzhag pas @192a * //
analyzed: de nye bar gzhag pas @192a * //
translated: By establishing that,

original: gti mug gi rkyen gyis zhe sdang drag po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gti mug gi rkyen gyis zhe sdang drag po 'byung ngo //
translated: the condition of delusion is the arising of strong hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi rkyen gyis khams gsum 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags drag po byung ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rkyen gyis khams gsum 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags drag po byung ste /
translated: The condition of hatred is the strong desire of the nature of the desire of the three realms.

original: 'dod chags des yang nas yang du dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags su skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags des yang nas yang du dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags su skye ba'o //
translated: By that desire, one is born again and again as a hell being, an animal, and a hungry ghost.

original: de ni nang gi dug gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni nang gi dug gsum mo //
translated: That is the inner three poisons.

original: phyi'i dug gsum ni bsdad pa'i dug yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i dug gsum ni bsdad pa'i dug yin te /
translated: The outer three poisons are the poisons of remaining.

original: btsan dug la sogs pa'i dug gis gsod pa dang / brgyal ba dang / smyo ba dang / 'gas pa dang / chu bur dang / long ba dang / lce lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / rengs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btsan dug la sogs pa'i dug gis gsod pa dang / brgyal ba dang / smyo ba dang / 'gas pa dang / chu bur dang / long ba dang / lce lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / rengs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The poisons of remaining are the poisons of killing with poison such as aconite, fainting, insanity, bursting, blisters, blindness, muteness, deafness, paralysis, and so on.

original: 'gro ba'i dug ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dug ni /
translated: The poisons of migrating beings

original: bsams pa dang / reg pa dang / kha rlangs so //
analyzed: bsams pa dang / reg pa dang / kha rlangs so //
translated: are thought, contact, and breath.

original: des ni rlung dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang / chu ser bzhi gtong bar nus so //
analyzed: des ni rlung dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa dang / chu ser bzhi gtong bar nus so //
translated: By this, one is able to expel the four: wind, phlegm, bile, and pus.

original: dngos po yod pa'i dug ni reg pa dang / kha rlangs dang / mche ba'i dug go //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i dug ni reg pa dang / kha rlangs dang / mche ba'i dug go //
translated: The poison of an existent thing is the poison of touch, breath, and fangs.

original: des kyang shi ba dang / rgas pa dang / rengs pa dang / chu bur dang / lce lkugs pa dang / mig mi mthong ba dang / 'on pa dang / lus rengs pa dang / de la sogs pa gtong nus pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang shi ba dang / rgas pa dang / rengs pa dang / chu bur dang / lce lkugs pa dang / mig mi mthong ba dang / 'on pa dang / lus rengs pa dang / de la sogs pa gtong nus pa'o //
translated: By that, one is able to expel death, old age, paralysis, blisters, muteness, blindness, deafness, and paralysis of the body.

original: dngos po med pa'i dug ni bsam pa dang mthong ba'i dug yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i dug ni bsam pa dang mthong ba'i dug yin te /
translated: The poison of a nonexistent thing is the poison of thought and sight.

original: bsam pas gnod pa ni stong phrag brgyad khri tsam gyi bar nas kyang gnod pa skyel nus pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pas gnod pa ni stong phrag brgyad khri tsam gyi bar nas kyang gnod pa skyel nus pa'o //
translated: The harm of thought is able to bring harm from as far away as eighty thousand leagues.

original: mthong ba'i dug ni dpag tshad lnga nas kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dug ni dpag tshad lnga nas kyang mthong ngo //
translated: The poison of sight sees from as far away as five leagues.

original: de gnyis kyang rlung bad kan mkhris pa chu ser gyi rang bzhin du yod pa de yangs bdag gi nad mdze rigs mi gcig pa bco brgyad gtong nus pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rlung bad kan mkhris pa chu ser gyi rang bzhin du yod pa de yangs bdag gi nad mdze rigs mi gcig pa bco brgyad gtong nus pa'o //
translated: Those two also exist as the nature of wind, phlegm, bile, and pus.

original: de rnams kyang shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa dang / dmu chu dang / chu bur dang / 'brum bu dang / sha bkra dang / mdzer pa dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang shu ba dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa dang / me dbal dang / lhog pa dang / dmu chu dang / chu bur dang / 'brum bu dang / sha bkra dang / mdzer pa dang /
translated: They are boils, scabies, leprosy, blisters, itching, inflammation, erysipelas, dropsy, blisters, smallpox, vitiligo, moles,

original: skrangs pa dang / glo dang / gcong dang / wa ba dang / mig tshags dang / ling thog dang / gag pa dang ngo //
analyzed: skrangs pa dang / glo dang / gcong dang / wa ba dang / mig tshags dang / ling thog dang / gag pa dang ngo //
translated: swelling, tuberculosis, tumors, cataracts, trachoma, and consumption.

original: de yang de rnams kyis gtong ngo //
analyzed: de yang de rnams kyis gtong ngo //
translated: Moreover, they release those.

original: gzhan gyi nad kyang klad pa na ba la sogs pa nad rigs mi gcig pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi gtong nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nad kyang klad pa na ba la sogs pa nad rigs mi gcig pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi gtong nus pa'o //
translated: They are also able to release the twenty-four different types of illnesses of others, such as headaches.

original: rims la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rims la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to fevers.

original: dug des kyang shi ba dang / gas pa dang / rengs pa dang / long ba dang / lce lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / rkang lag zha ba dang / de rnams la sogs pa lus @192b kyi na tsha drag po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dug des kyang shi ba dang / gas pa dang / rengs pa dang / long ba dang / lce lkugs pa dang / 'on pa dang / rkang lag zha ba dang / de rnams la sogs pa lus @192b kyi na tsha drag po 'byung ba'o //
translated: That poison also causes death, splitting, paralysis, blindness, muteness, deafness, lameness, and other severe physical illnesses.

original: bsam pa'i dug can dang / mthong ba'i dug can gyis ni lo bdun bar du phyir 'phang ngo //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dug can dang / mthong ba'i dug can gyis ni lo bdun bar du phyir 'phang ngo //
translated: The poison of thought and the poison of sight are expelled in seven years.

original: de ni dngos su med pa'i dug go //
analyzed: de ni dngos su med pa'i dug go //
translated: This is the poison that is not actually present.

original: de la byed pa'i dug ni /
analyzed: de la byed pa'i dug ni /
translated: The poison of action is

original: phyi dug nag po dang / rin po che dbyig dug dang / bdud rtsi las byung ba'i dug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dug nag po dang / rin po che dbyig dug dang / bdud rtsi las byung ba'i dug la sogs pa'o //
translated: the black external poison, the poison of precious jewels, the poison that arises from nectar, and so forth.

original: sbyor ba'i dug de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dug de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: The poison of application is inconceivable.

original: phyi dug nag po ni /
analyzed: phyi dug nag po ni /
translated: The black external poison

original: dngul chu dang spu dug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dngul chu dang spu dug las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from mercury and bird feathers.

original: rin po che dbyig dug ni gser dngul zangs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che dbyig dug ni gser dngul zangs las byung ba'o //
translated: The poison of precious jewels arises from gold, silver, and copper.

original: bdud rtsi dug ni sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / 'khar ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi dug ni sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / 'khar ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The poison of nectar arises from honey, butter, and iron.

original: des kyang mdze dang phol mig la sogs pa gtong nus pa /
analyzed: des kyang mdze dang phol mig la sogs pa gtong nus pa /
translated: They are also able to inflict leprosy, boils, and so forth.

original: tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / tshigs gzhi na ba dang / phyin ba dang / nang na na ba dang / shi ba dang / smyo ba dang / rengs pa dang / long ba dang / 'on pa dang / lce lkugs pa dang /
analyzed: tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / tshigs gzhi na ba dang / phyin ba dang / nang na na ba dang / shi ba dang / smyo ba dang / rengs pa dang / long ba dang / 'on pa dang / lce lkugs pa dang /
translated: internal pain, death, insanity, paralysis, blindness, deafness, dumbness,

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin du 'dar ba dang / pho ba la sogs pa na nus pa'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin du 'dar ba dang / pho ba la sogs pa na nus pa'o //
translated: and the nature of bile, trembling, and pain in the stomach and so on.

original: rig sngags des ni de lta bu'i dug bcom mo //
analyzed: rig sngags des ni de lta bu'i dug bcom mo //
translated: By that knowledge-mantra, such poison is destroyed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha's splendor destroys poison means

original: rgyu med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: the nature of causelessness is free from essence, like space.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis me long gi gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang chu'i zla ba bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis me long gi gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang chu'i zla ba bzhin du gnas so //
translated: By that nature, like a reflection in a mirror, a mirage, or the moon in water, it abides.

original: de'i ngang las 'jig rten khams su khyab pa las dang bag chags zhes bya ba bcom nas /
analyzed: de'i ngang las 'jig rten khams su khyab pa las dang bag chags zhes bya ba bcom nas /
translated: From that state, pervading the world-systems, what is called karma and traces is destroyed.

original: sems can rnams la nam mkha' bzhin du khyab pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la nam mkha' bzhin du khyab pa ste /
translated: It pervades sentient beings like space.

original: lus ngag yid gsum sangs rgyas nas bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum sangs rgyas nas bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
translated: Having attained Buddhahood in body, speech, and mind, the four Maras are conquered.

original: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo//
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo//
translated: By such splendor the poison is destroyed.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The splendor of the Pratyekabuddha destroys the poison.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid ni lhag mthong gnyis yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid ni lhag mthong gnyis yin /
translated: The splendor of the Pratyekabuddha is the two kinds of insight.

original: lhag ma ni stong pa nyid du bsgom pa mthong ba ni lus kyi bya ba bstan nas sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni stong pa nyid du bsgom pa mthong ba ni lus kyi bya ba bstan nas sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: The rest is taught by the vision of the meditation on emptiness, having shown the bodily action, and is taught to the sentient beings.

original: de gnyis kyi bden pa'i gzi brjid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyis dug bcom mo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bden pa'i gzi brjid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyis dug bcom mo //
translated: By the splendor of the truth of those two, the poison is destroyed by the Pratyekabuddha.

original: dgra bcom pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The splendor of the Arhat destroys the poison.

original: dgra ni bdud bzhi ste /
analyzed: dgra ni bdud bzhi ste /
translated: The enemy is the four Maras.

original: bdud bzhi ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The four Maras are ignorance.

original: ma rig pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Ignorance is samsara.

original: de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i dgra bcom ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i dgra bcom ste /
translated: Such is the enemy of samsara, which is conquered.

original: de'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo //
analyzed: de'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo //
translated: By its splendor the poison is destroyed.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzi @193a * //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i gzi @193a * //
translated: The splendor of the Anagamin

original: brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la gzhan gyi don mi byed pa ni phyir mi ldog pa rnams so //
analyzed: brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la gzhan gyi don mi byed pa ni phyir mi ldog pa rnams so //
translated: The poison is destroyed by the majesty of the irreversible ones.

original: de rnams ni 'gog pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'gog pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: They have the nature of cessation.

original: de'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
translated: The poison is destroyed by their majesty.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The poison is destroyed by the majesty of the once-returners.

original: cung zad tsam sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad tsam sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: They benefit sentient beings a little.

original: bag chags kyi sgrib pa bcom nas shes bya tsam gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi sgrib pa bcom nas shes bya tsam gnas pa'o //
translated: Having destroyed the obscurations of habitual tendencies, they abide in mere knowable objects.

original: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom mo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom mo //
translated: The poison is destroyed by such majesty.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The poison is destroyed by the majesty of the stream-enterers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams kyi don byed pa mi dmigs pa'i snying rje skye ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams kyi don byed pa mi dmigs pa'i snying rje skye ba'o //
translated: The nature of the bodhisattvas is the arising of nonreferential compassion that benefits sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
translated: The poison is destroyed by such majesty.

original: bden par smra ba'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bden par smra ba'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The poison is destroyed by the majesty of speaking the truth.

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyis kyang bka' bden par smra ba gzhan yang 'jig rten pa drang srong rnams kyi bka' bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyis kyang bka' bden par smra ba gzhan yang 'jig rten pa drang srong rnams kyi bka' bden pa'o //
translated: The words of the Buddhas of the past, the future, and the present are true. The words of the sages of the world are true.

original: de'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
translated: By the power of that, poison is destroyed.

original: tshangs pa'i be con gyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i be con gyi gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The power of Brahma's staff destroys poison.

original: tshangs pa'i be con ni dbyu gu gsum yin te dbyu gu gcig ni sku brtag pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i be con ni dbyu gu gsum yin te dbyu gu gcig ni sku brtag pa /
translated: Brahma's staff is three cubits long. One cubit is the body,

original: gnyis pa gsung brtag pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa gsung brtag pa /
translated: the second is speech,

original: gsum pa ni yid brtag pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yid brtag pa'o //
translated: and the third is the mind.

original: de gsum ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin de lta bu'i bden pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de gsum ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin de lta bu'i bden pa'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
translated: By the power of the truth of those three, which are the nature of the three realms, poison is destroyed.

original: dbang po'i rdo rje'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rdo rje ni gang la 'phangs pa'i sar dgra rnams 'dul zhing slar rang gi lag tu 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rdo rje'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rdo rje ni gang la 'phangs pa'i sar dgra rnams 'dul zhing slar rang gi lag tu 'ong ba'o //
translated: The power of Indra's vajra destroys poison. Indra's vajra is a weapon that subdues enemies wherever it is thrown and returns to one's hand.

original: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
translated: The poison was destroyed by such splendor.

original: khyab 'jug gi 'khor los dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyab 'jug gi 'khor los dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The poison was destroyed by Vishnu's discus.

original: sa 'og sa steng sa bla gsum la 'phangs pa tsam gyis 'khor lo des dbang mdzad de /
analyzed: sa 'og sa steng sa bla gsum la 'phangs pa tsam gyis 'khor lo des dbang mdzad de /
translated: In the three realms below, on, and above the earth, by merely throwing it, that discus gained power.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug tu grags pa'o //
translated: It is renowned as the lord of the three worlds.

original: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis dug bcom pa'o //
translated: The poison was destroyed by such splendor.

original: me dbal gyi dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me dbal gyi dug bcom mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The poison was destroyed by the poison of the fire god.

original: me ni tsha ba dang sreg par nus pa /
analyzed: me ni tsha ba dang sreg par nus pa /
translated: Fire is capable of heat and burning.

original: des kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sreg par nus pa de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sreg par nus pa de lta bu'i gzi brjid kyis kyang dug bcom pa'o //
translated: By such splendor, the poison was destroyed.

translated: Why is the king of mountains called Horse Ear Mountain?

original: ri'i rgyal po rta rma ri'i rtse mo dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ni /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po rta rma ri'i rtse mo dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ni /

original: dper na rta'i rna ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rta'i rna ba bzhin te /

original: de'i phyir ri'i rgyal po rta rna ri zhes bya'o //🔽ri'i rgyal po rnam 'dud dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri'i rgyal po rta rna ri zhes bya'o // ri'i rgyal po rnam 'dud dang zhes bya ba ni /

original: ri'i rgyal po rta rna ri nas dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya bor nas /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po rta rna ri nas dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya bor nas /

original: dpag tshad brgyad khri chu'i 'og nas gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten te /
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri chu'i 'og nas gser gyi sa gzhi chen po la brten te /

analyzed: dpag tshad stong nyis brgya lnga bcu ni chu las gyen du 'phags so //

original: rngams su yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rngams su yang de dang 'dra ste /

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes ba /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes ba /

original: gser las grub pa /
analyzed: gser las grub pa /

analyzed: de na rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi grong dang grong khyer dang ljongs gnas so //

analyzed: dper na gnyan ru bzhin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir na ri'i rgyal po rnam par 'dud ces bya'o //

analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i 'byung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi /

analyzed: de dag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la bsrung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /

original: gang zag gang yang rung ba 'di la gus par byas na /
analyzed: gang zag gang yang rung ba 'di la gus par byas na /

analyzed: ri'i rgyal po de rnams la yod pa'i lha la sogs pa srung zhing skyob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sba ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: mi dge ba bcu ni /

analyzed: lus la gsum /

analyzed: ngag la bzhi /

analyzed: yid la gsum mo //

analyzed: lus la gsum ni srog gcod pa /

analyzed: ma byin par len pa /

analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa'o //

analyzed: ngag gi bzhi ni /

analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di'i gzi brjid kyis sdig pa de dag thams kyi na tsha rims la sogs pa 'byung pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams rig sngags dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos grub snang ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub bo //

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos grub ni /

translated: The extraordinary power is
